column72: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.
column95: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.
column100: Do you want to be a key player in improving the safety performance for our colleagues offshore? Do you thrive by interacting and engaging with colleagues both onshore and offshore? Then this might be the right match for you! Your Position The role of a HSE coordinator is to be a very important sparring partner for both our Operation Support department and our Client. The HSE coordinator will work as a driver for a safe project execution, and contribute to increased safety awareness. You will work closely with our skilled colleagues in the HSEQ team of 12 colleagues and refer to our Director HSEQ. Your tasks and responsibilities The position enhance close involvement with offshore personnel and the HSE coordinator will be able to continuously provide feedback on HSE initiatives, and spot new HSE solutions. You will have daily interaction and communication regarding HSE execution and improvements with internal and external partners Your tasks will include but are not limited to: Communication of HSE initiatives with offshore personnel Communication and coordination of HSE initiatives according to approved HSE plan Coordinate the HSE work in close corporation with the client Reporting of HSE data and other project data monthly Participation in risk analysis and investigations Set up preventive activities on basis of data, input, and other information Your profile and qualifications You thrive by having responsibility and you are proactive. You love being able engage with both internal and external stakeholders and also enjoy tasks behind the pc. You are service minded and have the courage to challenge the as is. You thrive as part of a team where you bring great energy and humor to ensure the best collaboration. To succeed in this position, we expect that you have: Min. 3 years of experience from a similar position within HSE - preferably with a technical background You have safety coaching skills and know when to apply these to improve performance You are familiar with major accident hazards, key safety legislation/regulations and process safety management Good communication skills in writing and speech both Danish and English (Danish is a prerequisite) Experience in Microsoft Office Welcome to Semco Maritime We offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international organization, where we strive to provide innovative and sustainable solutions globally. You will get the unique opportunity to work in an environment characterized by dedication, passion and ambition. The work is carried out primarily from the head office in Esbjerg and occasionally offshore visits will also be part of the job. Furthermore, there is possibility of working from home to the extent that the tasks allow. We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Dorthe Ulsø, Director HSEQ, by phone +45 2525 6594 We look forward to hearing from you!
